<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 5"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dagger of Venom](/Equipment.aspx?ID=383)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magical" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=103" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Poison" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=126" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 600 <sup>4.0</sup>

**Price** 150 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Usage** held in 1 hand

**Bulk** L
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Base Weapon** [Dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

The serrated blade of this _+1 striking [dagger](/Weapons.aspx?ID=3)_ has a greenish tinge, and the hilt is sculpted to look like the head of a serpent about to strike. When you critically succeed at an attack roll with the _dagger of venom_, the target becomes [sickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34) unless it succeeds at a DC 19 Fortitude save. This is a [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126) effect. In addition, you can activate the dagger to poison a creature with a more potent poison.

**Activate** <actions string="Free Action" /> Interact;  **Frequency** once per day; **Trigger** You damage a creature with the _dagger of venom_;  **Effect** You poison the creature you hit with dagger venom.

 **Dagger Venom** ([poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)); **Saving Throw** Fortitude DC 21; **Maximum Duration** 4 rounds. **Stage 1** 1d8 poison damage and [enfeebled 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=13).

<column gap="tiny">

</column>
